titles.title: Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.
Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-264, by Ms. Matsui.
Provide for motions to suspend the rules at any time through the legislative day of September 24, 2009. The resolution applies to motions related to H.R. 3631, "the Medicare Premium Fairness Act."

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 111.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 766.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 235 - 182 (Roll no. 735).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Makes it in order at any time through September 24, 2009, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules relating to H.R. 3631 (amending title XVIII [Medicare] of the Social Security Act) to provide for the application of a consistent Medicare part B (Supplementary Medical Insurance Benefits for Aged and Disabled) premium for all Medicare beneficiaries in a budget neutral manner for 2010.
